intro: Galium cruciata var. laxa, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
